info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 06 at 9:34PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN BRACKEN, NORTHEASTERN PENDLETON, SOUTHEASTERN CLERMONT AND SOUTHWESTERN BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM EST... At 933 PM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located near Neville, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Augusta, Felicity, Russellville, Hamersville, Higginsport, Neville, Chilo, Mount Auburn, Redoak, Woolcutt, Willow Grove, Bradford, Lenoxburg, Kincaid Lake State Park, Foster, Feesburg, Johnsville, Rock Springs and Utopia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
